definition[0]: to take back cars, furniture, or property from people who had arranged to pay for them over a long time, but cannot now continue to pay for them
example[0]: Eventually the bailiffs came to repossess the flat.
definition[1]: to take back a car, property etc from someone who had arranged to pay for them over a long time, but cannot now continue to pay for them
example[1]: Creditors are seeking to repossess 10 jets.
